intro: Oxera bignonioides, commonly known as the silverleaf oxera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, bloom in late spring to early summer. Oxera bignonioides is adapted to a variety of soil types and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
